    3645           0 :                 case '"': return startNewMode( QuotedName, ++m_pos );
    3646             :                 case '\\': return escape();
    3647           0 :                 default: startNewMode( Name, m_pos ); break;
    3648             :                 }
    3649             :             }
    3650           1 :             if( m_mode == Name ) {
    3651           0 :                 if( c == ',' ) {
    3652           0 :                     addPattern<TestSpec::NamePattern>();
    3653           0 :                     addFilter();
    3654             :                 }

    3664             :             }

    3666           0 :                 m_mode = Name;

    3668           0 :                 addPattern<TestSpec::NamePattern>();

    3673           1 :             m_mode = mode;

    4036             : 
    4037             :     struct TextAttributes {
    4038             :         TextAttributes()
    4039             :         :   initialIndent( std::string::npos ),
    4040             :             indent( 0 ),
    4041             :             width( consoleWidth-1 ),
    4042           0 :             tabChar( '\t' )

    4044             : 
    4045             :         TextAttributes& setInitialIndent( std::size_t _value )  { initialIndent = _value; return *this; }

    4047           0 :         TextAttributes& setWidth( std::size_t _value )          { width = _value; return *this; }
    4048             :         TextAttributes& setTabChar( char _value )               { tabChar = _value; return *this; }
    4049             : 
    4050             :         std::size_t initialIndent;  // indent of first line, or npos
    4051             :         std::size_t indent;         // indent of subsequent lines, or all if initialIndent is npos
    4052             :         std::size_t width;          // maximum width of text, including indent. Longer text will wrap
    4053             :         char tabChar;               // If this char is seen the indent is changed to current pos
    4054             :     };
    4055             : 
    4056           0 :     class Text {
    4057             :     public:
    4058           0 :         Text( std::string const& _str, TextAttributes const& _attr = TextAttributes() )
    4059           0 :         : attr( _attr )
    4060             :         {
    4061           0 :             std::string wrappableChars = " [({.,/|\\-";
    4062           0 :             std::size_t indent = _attr.initialIndent != std::string::npos
    4063             :                 ? _attr.initialIndent
    4064           0 :                 : _attr.indent;
    4065           0 :             std::string remainder = _str;
    4066             : 
    4067           0 :             while( !remainder.empty() ) {
    4068           0 :                 if( lines.size() >= 1000 ) {
    4069           0 :                     lines.push_back( "... message truncated due to excessive size" );
    4070           0 :                     return;
    4071             :                 }
    4072           0 :                 std::size_t tabPos = std::string::npos;
    4073           0 :                 std::size_t width = (std::min)( remainder.size(), _attr.width - indent );
    4074           0 :                 std::size_t pos = remainder.find_first_of( '\n' );
    4075           0 :                 if( pos <= width ) {
    4076           0 :                     width = pos;
    4077             :                 }
    4078           0 :                 pos = remainder.find_last_of( _attr.tabChar, width );
    4079           0 :                 if( pos != std::string::npos ) {
    4080           0 :                     tabPos = pos;
    4081           0 :                     if( remainder[width] == '\n' )
    4082           0 :                         width--;
    4083           0 :                     remainder = remainder.substr( 0, tabPos ) + remainder.substr( tabPos+1 );
    4084             :                 }
    4085             : 
    4086           0 :                 if( width == remainder.size() ) {
    4087           0 :                     spliceLine( indent, remainder, width );
    4088             :                 }
    4089           0 :                 else if( remainder[width] == '\n' ) {
    4090           0 :                     spliceLine( indent, remainder, width );
    4091           0 :                     if( width <= 1 || remainder.size() != 1 )
    4092           0 :                         remainder = remainder.substr( 1 );
    4093           0 :                     indent = _attr.indent;
    4094             :                 }
    4095             :                 else {
    4096           0 :                     pos = remainder.find_last_of( wrappableChars, width );
    4097           0 :                     if( pos != std::string::npos && pos > 0 ) {
    4098           0 :                         spliceLine( indent, remainder, pos );
    4099           0 :                         if( remainder[0] == ' ' )
    4100           0 :                             remainder = remainder.substr( 1 );
    4101             :                     }
    4102             :                     else {
    4103           0 :                         spliceLine( indent, remainder, width-1 );
    4104           0 :                         lines.back() += "-";
    4105             :                     }
    4106           0 :                     if( lines.size() == 1 )
    4107           0 :                         indent = _attr.indent;
    4108           0 :                     if( tabPos != std::string::npos )
    4109           0 :                         indent += tabPos;
    4110             :                 }
    4111             :             }
    4112             :         }
    4113             : 
    4114           0 :         void spliceLine( std::size_t _indent, std::string& _remainder, std::size_t _pos ) {
    4115           0 :             lines.push_back( std::string( _indent, ' ' ) + _remainder.substr( 0, _pos ) );
    4116           0 :             _remainder = _remainder.substr( _pos );
    4117           0 :         }

    4127             :             std::ostringstream oss;

    4129             :             return oss.str();
    4130             :         }
    4131             : 
    4132             :         inline friend std::ostream& operator << ( std::ostream& _stream, Text const& _text ) {
    4133             :             for( Text::const_iterator it = _text.begin(), itEnd = _text.end();

    4148             : } // end namespace Tbc
    4149             : 
    4150             : #ifdef STITCH_TBC_TEXT_FORMAT_OUTER_NAMESPACE
    4151             : } // end outer namespace
    4152             : #endif
    4153             : 
    4154             : #endif // TBC_TEXT_FORMAT_H_INCLUDED
    4155             : 
    4156             : // ----------- end of #include from tbc_text_format.h -----------
    4157             : // ........... back in clara.h
    4158             : 
    4159             : #undef STITCH_TBC_TEXT_FORMAT_OPEN_NAMESPACE
    4160             : 
    4161             : // ----------- #included from clara_compilers.h -----------
    4162             : 
    4163             : #ifndef TWOBLUECUBES_CLARA_COMPILERS_H_INCLUDED
    4164             : #define TWOBLUECUBES_CLARA_COMPILERS_H_INCLUDED
    4165             : 
    4166             : // Detect a number of compiler features - mostly C++11/14 conformance - by compiler
    4167             : // The following features are defined:
    4168             : //
    4169             : // CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NULLPTR : is nullptr supported?
    4170             : // CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NOEXCEPT : is noexcept supported?
    4171             : // CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_GENERATED_METHODS : The delete and default keywords for compiler generated methods
    4172             : // CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_OVERRIDE : is override supported?
    4173             : // CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_UNIQUE_PTR : is unique_ptr supported (otherwise use auto_ptr)
    4174             : 
    4175             : // CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_OR_GREATER : Is C++11 supported?
    4176             : 
    4177             : // CLARA_CONFIG_VARIADIC_MACROS : are variadic macros supported?
    4178             : 
    4179             : // In general each macro has a _NO_<feature name> form
    4180             : // (e.g. CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NO_NULLPTR) which disables the feature.
    4181             : // Many features, at point of detection, define an _INTERNAL_ macro, so they
    4182             : // can be combined, en-mass, with the _NO_ forms later.
    4183             : 
    4184             : // All the C++11 features can be disabled with CLARA_CONFIG_NO_CPP11
    4185             : 
    4186             : #ifdef __clang__
    4187             : 
    4188             : #if __has_feature(cxx_nullptr)
    4189             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NULLPTR
    4190             : #endif
    4191             : 
    4192             : #if __has_feature(cxx_noexcept)
    4193             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NOEXCEPT
    4194             : #endif
    4195             : 
    4196             : #endif // __clang__
    4197             : 
    4198             : ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
    4199             : // GCC
    4200             : #ifdef __GNUC__
    4201             : 
    4202             : #if __GNUC__ == 4 && __GNUC_MINOR__ >= 6 && defined(__GXX_EXPERIMENTAL_CXX0X__)
    4203             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NULLPTR
    4204             : #endif
    4205             : 
    4206             : // - otherwise more recent versions define __cplusplus >= 201103L
    4207             : // and will get picked up below
    4208             : 
    4209             : #endif // __GNUC__
    4210             : 
    4211             : ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
    4212             : // Visual C++
    4213             : #ifdef _MSC_VER
    4214             : 
    4215             : #if (_MSC_VER >= 1600)
    4216             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NULLPTR
    4217             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_UNIQUE_PTR
    4218             : #endif
    4219             : 
    4220             : #if (_MSC_VER >= 1900 ) // (VC++ 13 (VS2015))
    4221             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NOEXCEPT
    4222             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_GENERATED_METHODS
    4223             : #endif
    4224             : 
    4225             : #endif // _MSC_VER
    4226             : 
    4227             : ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
    4228             : // C++ language feature support
    4229             : 
    4230             : // catch all support for C++11
    4231             : #if defined(__cplusplus) && __cplusplus >= 201103L
    4232             : 
    4233             : #define CLARA_CPP11_OR_GREATER
    4234             : 
    4235             : #if !defined(CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NULLPTR)
    4236             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NULLPTR
    4237             : #endif
    4238             : 
    4239             : #ifndef CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NOEXCEPT
    4240             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NOEXCEPT
    4241             : #endif
    4242             : 
    4243             : #ifndef CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_GENERATED_METHODS
    4244             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_GENERATED_METHODS
    4245             : #endif
    4246             : 
    4247             : #if !defined(CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_OVERRIDE)
    4248             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_OVERRIDE
    4249             : #endif
    4250             : #if !defined(CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_UNIQUE_PTR)
    4251             : #define CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_UNIQUE_PTR
    4252             : #endif
    4253             : 
    4254             : #endif // __cplusplus >= 201103L
    4255             : 
    4256             : // Now set the actual defines based on the above + anything the user has configured
    4257             : #if defined(CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NULLPTR) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NO_NULLPTR) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NULLPTR) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_NO_CPP11)
    4258             : #define CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NULLPTR
    4259             : #endif
    4260             : #if defined(CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_NOEXCEPT) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NO_NOEXCEPT) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NOEXCEPT) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_NO_CPP11)
    4261             : #define CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NOEXCEPT
    4262             : #endif
    4263             : #if defined(CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_GENERATED_METHODS) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NO_GENERATED_METHODS) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_GENERATED_METHODS) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_NO_CPP11)
    4264             : #define CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_GENERATED_METHODS
    4265             : #endif
    4266             : #if defined(CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_OVERRIDE) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_NO_OVERRIDE) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_OVERRIDE) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_NO_CPP11)
    4267             : #define CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_OVERRIDE
    4268             : #endif
    4269             : #if defined(CLARA_INTERNAL_CONFIG_CPP11_UNIQUE_PTR) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_NO_UNIQUE_PTR) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_UNIQUE_PTR) && !defined(CLARA_CONFIG_NO_CPP11)
    4270             : #define CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_UNIQUE_PTR
    4271             : #endif
    4272             : 
    4273             : // noexcept support:
    4274             : #if defined(CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NOEXCEPT) && !defined(CLARA_NOEXCEPT)
    4275             : #define CLARA_NOEXCEPT noexcept
    4276             : #  define CLARA_NOEXCEPT_IS(x) noexcept(x)
    4277             : #else
    4278             : #define CLARA_NOEXCEPT throw()
    4279             : #  define CLARA_NOEXCEPT_IS(x)
    4280             : #endif
    4281             : 
    4282             : // nullptr support
    4283             : #ifdef CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_NULLPTR
    4284             : #define CLARA_NULL nullptr
    4285             : #else
    4286             : #define CLARA_NULL NULL
    4287             : #endif
    4288             : 
    4289             : // override support
    4290             : #ifdef CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_OVERRIDE
    4291             : #define CLARA_OVERRIDE override
    4292             : #else
    4293             : #define CLARA_OVERRIDE
    4294             : #endif
    4295             : 
    4296             : // unique_ptr support
    4297             : #ifdef CLARA_CONFIG_CPP11_UNIQUE_PTR
    4298             : #   define CLARA_AUTO_PTR( T ) std::unique_ptr<T>
    4299             : #else
    4300             : #   define CLARA_AUTO_PTR( T ) std::auto_ptr<T>
    4301             : #endif
    4302             : 
    4303             : #endif // TWOBLUECUBES_CLARA_COMPILERS_H_INCLUDED
    4304             : 
    4305             : // ----------- end of #include from clara_compilers.h -----------
    4306             : // ........... back in clara.h
    4307             : 
    4308             : #include <map>
    4309             : #include <stdexcept>
    4310             : #include <memory>
    4311             : 
    4312             : #if defined(WIN32) || defined(__WIN32__) || defined(_WIN32) || defined(_MSC_VER)
    4313             : #define CLARA_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
    4314             : #endif
    4315             : 
    4316             : // Use optional outer namespace
    4317             : #ifdef STITCH_CLARA_OPEN_NAMESPACE

    4319             : #endif

    4346             :         template<typename T> struct RemoveConstRef<T&>{ typedef T type; };

    4348             :         template<typename T> struct RemoveConstRef<T const>{ typedef T type; };

    4354           0 :         void convertInto( std::string const& _source, T& _dest ) {
    4355           0 :             std::stringstream ss;
    4356           0 :             ss << _source;
    4357           0 :             ss >> _dest;
    4358           0 :             if( ss.fail() )
    4359           0 :                 throw std::runtime_error( "Unable to convert " + _source + " to destination type" );
    4360           0 :         }

    4362           1 :             _dest = _source;
    4363             :         }
    4364           0 :         char toLowerCh(char c) {
    4365           0 :             return static_cast<char>( ::tolower( c ) );
    4366             :         }
    4367           0 :         inline void convertInto( std::string const& _source, bool& _dest ) {
    4368           0 :             std::string sourceLC = _source;
    4369           0 :             std::transform( sourceLC.begin(), sourceLC.end(), sourceLC.begin(), toLowerCh );

    4496             :     class Parser {
    4497             :         enum Mode { None, MaybeShortOpt, SlashOpt, ShortOpt, LongOpt, Positional };
    4498             :         Mode mode;
    4499             :         std::size_t from;
    4500             :         bool inQuotes;
    4501             :     public:
    4502             : 
    4503           0 :         struct Token {
    4504             :             enum Type { Positional, ShortOpt, LongOpt };
    4505           0 :             Token( Type _type, std::string const& _data ) : type( _type ), data( _data ) {}
    4506             :             Type type;
    4507             :             std::string data;

    4510           1 :         Parser() : mode( None ), from( 0 ), inQuotes( false ){}
    4511             : 
    4512           1 :         void parseIntoTokens( std::vector<std::string> const& args, std::vector<Token>& tokens ) {
    4513           3 :             const std::string doubleDash = "--";
    4514           1 :             for( std::size_t i = 1; i < args.size() && args[i] != doubleDash; ++i )
    4515           0 :                 parseIntoTokens( args[i], tokens);
    4516           1 :         }
    4517             : 
    4518           0 :         void parseIntoTokens( std::string const& arg, std::vector<Token>& tokens ) {
    4519           0 :             for( std::size_t i = 0; i <= arg.size(); ++i ) {
    4520           0 :                 char c = arg[i];
    4521           0 :                 if( c == '"' )
    4522           0 :                     inQuotes = !inQuotes;
    4523           0 :                 mode = handleMode( i, c, arg, tokens );
    4524             :             }
    4525           0 :         }
    4526           0 :         Mode handleMode( std::size_t i, char c, std::string const& arg, std::vector<Token>& tokens ) {
    4527           0 :             switch( mode ) {
    4528           0 :                 case None: return handleNone( i, c );
    4529           0 :                 case MaybeShortOpt: return handleMaybeShortOpt( i, c );
    4530             :                 case ShortOpt:
    4531             :                 case LongOpt:
    4532           0 :                 case SlashOpt: return handleOpt( i, c, arg, tokens );
    4533           0 :                 case Positional: return handlePositional( i, c, arg, tokens );
    4534           0 :                 default: throw std::logic_error( "Unknown mode" );
    4535             :             }
    4536             :         }
    4537             : 
    4538             :         Mode handleNone( std::size_t i, char c ) {
    4539           0 :             if( inQuotes ) {
    4540           0 :                 from = i;
    4541             :                 return Positional;
    4542             :             }
    4543           0 :             switch( c ) {
    4544             :                 case '-': return MaybeShortOpt;
    4545             : #ifdef CLARA_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
    4546             :                 case '/': from = i+1; return SlashOpt;
    4547             : #endif
    4548           0 :                 default: from = i; return Positional;
    4549             :             }
    4550             :         }
    4551             :         Mode handleMaybeShortOpt( std::size_t i, char c ) {
    4552           0 :             switch( c ) {
    4553           0 :                 case '-': from = i+1; return LongOpt;
    4554           0 :                 default: from = i; return ShortOpt;
    4555             :             }
    4556             :         }
    4557           0 :         Mode handleOpt( std::size_t i, char c, std::string const& arg, std::vector<Token>& tokens ) {
    4558           0 :             if( std::string( ":=\0", 3 ).find( c ) == std::string::npos )
    4559           0 :                 return mode;
    4560             : 
    4561           0 :             std::string optName = arg.substr( from, i-from );
    4562           0 :             if( mode == ShortOpt )
    4563           0 :                 for( std::size_t j = 0; j < optName.size(); ++j )
    4564           0 :                     tokens.push_back( Token( Token::ShortOpt, optName.substr( j, 1 ) ) );
    4565           0 :             else if( mode == SlashOpt && optName.size() == 1 )
    4566           0 :                 tokens.push_back( Token( Token::ShortOpt, optName ) );
    4567             :             else
    4568           0 :                 tokens.push_back( Token( Token::LongOpt, optName ) );
    4569           0 :             return None;
    4570             :         }
    4571           0 :         Mode handlePositional( std::size_t i, char c, std::string const& arg, std::vector<Token>& tokens ) {
    4572           0 :             if( inQuotes || std::string( "\0", 1 ).find( c ) == std::string::npos )
    4573           0 :                 return mode;
    4574             : 
    4575           0 :             std::string data = arg.substr( from, i-from );
    4576           0 :             tokens.push_back( Token( Token::Positional, data ) );
    4577           0 :             return None;
    4578             :         }
    4579             :     };

    5090             : 
    5091           0 :         std::string line;
    5092           0 :         while( std::getline( f, line ) ) {

    5095           0 :                 if( !startsWith( line, '"' ) )

    5097           0 :                 addTestOrTags( config, line + ',' );

    5257             :     struct TextAttributes {
    5258             :         TextAttributes()
    5259             :         :   initialIndent( std::string::npos ),
    5260             :             indent( 0 ),
    5261           0 :             width( consoleWidth-1 )
    5262             :         {}
    5263             : 
    5264           0 :         TextAttributes& setInitialIndent( std::size_t _value )  { initialIndent = _value; return *this; }
    5265           0 :         TextAttributes& setIndent( std::size_t _value )         { indent = _value; return *this; }
    5266           0 :         TextAttributes& setWidth( std::size_t _value )          { width = _value; return *this; }
    5267             : 
    5268             :         std::size_t initialIndent;  // indent of first line, or npos
    5269             :         std::size_t indent;         // indent of subsequent lines, or all if initialIndent is npos
    5270             :         std::size_t width;          // maximum width of text, including indent. Longer text will wrap
    5271             :     };
    5272             : 
    5273           0 :     class Text {
    5274             :     public:
    5275           0 :         Text( std::string const& _str, TextAttributes const& _attr = TextAttributes() )
    5276           0 :         : attr( _attr )
    5277             :         {
    5278           0 :             const std::string wrappableBeforeChars = "[({<\t";
    5279           0 :             const std::string wrappableAfterChars = "])}>-,./|\\";
    5280           0 :             const std::string wrappableInsteadOfChars = " \n\r";
    5281           0 :             std::string indent = _attr.initialIndent != std::string::npos
    5282           0 :                 ? std::string( _attr.initialIndent, ' ' )
    5283           0 :                 : std::string( _attr.indent, ' ' );
    5284             : 
    5285             :             typedef std::string::const_iterator iterator;
    5286           0 :             iterator it = _str.begin();
    5287           0 :             const iterator strEnd = _str.end();
    5288             : 
    5289           0 :             while( it != strEnd ) {
    5290             : 
    5291           0 :                 if( lines.size() >= 1000 ) {
    5292           0 :                     lines.push_back( "... message truncated due to excessive size" );
    5293           0 :                     return;
    5294             :                 }
    5295             : 
    5296           0 :                 std::string suffix;
    5297           0 :                 std::size_t width = (std::min)( static_cast<size_t>( strEnd-it ), _attr.width-static_cast<size_t>( indent.size() ) );
    5298           0 :                 iterator itEnd = it+width;
    5299           0 :                 iterator itNext = _str.end();
    5300             : 
    5301           0 :                 iterator itNewLine = std::find( it, itEnd, '\n' );
    5302           0 :                 if( itNewLine != itEnd )
    5303           0 :                     itEnd = itNewLine;
    5304             : 
    5305           0 :                 if( itEnd != strEnd  ) {
    5306             :                     bool foundWrapPoint = false;
    5307             :                     iterator findIt = itEnd;
    5308             :                     do {
    5309           0 :                         if( wrappableAfterChars.find( *findIt ) != std::string::npos && findIt != itEnd ) {
    5310           0 :                             itEnd = findIt+1;
    5311           0 :                             itNext = findIt+1;
    5312           0 :                             foundWrapPoint = true;
    5313             :                         }
    5314           0 :                         else if( findIt > it && wrappableBeforeChars.find( *findIt ) != std::string::npos ) {
    5315             :                             itEnd = findIt;
    5316             :                             itNext = findIt;
    5317             :                             foundWrapPoint = true;
    5318             :                         }
    5319           0 :                         else if( wrappableInsteadOfChars.find( *findIt ) != std::string::npos ) {
    5320           0 :                             itNext = findIt+1;
    5321           0 :                             itEnd = findIt;
    5322           0 :                             foundWrapPoint = true;
    5323             :                         }
    5324           0 :                         if( findIt == it )
    5325             :                             break;
    5326             :                         else
    5327           0 :                             --findIt;
    5328             :                     }
    5329           0 :                     while( !foundWrapPoint );
    5330             : 
    5331           0 :                     if( !foundWrapPoint ) {
    5332             :                         // No good wrap char, so we'll break mid word and add a hyphen
    5333           0 :                         --itEnd;
    5334           0 :                         itNext = itEnd;
    5335             :                         suffix = "-";
    5336             :                     }
    5337             :                     else {
    5338           0 :                         while( itEnd > it && wrappableInsteadOfChars.find( *(itEnd-1) ) != std::string::npos )
    5339             :                             --itEnd;
    5340             :                     }
    5341             :                 }
    5342           0 :                 lines.push_back( indent + std::string( it, itEnd ) + suffix );
    5343             : 
    5344           0 :                 if( indent.size() != _attr.indent )
    5345           0 :                     indent = std::string( _attr.indent, ' ' );
    5346           0 :                 it = itNext;
    5347             :             }
    5348             :         }
    5349             :

    5352           0 :         const_iterator begin() const { return lines.begin(); }

    6054          11 :                 m_parent->openChild();
    6055             :         }
    6056             : 
    6057          11 :         virtual void close() CATCH_OVERRIDE {
    6058             : 
    6059             :             // Close any still open children (e.g. generators)
    6060          11 :             while( &m_ctx.currentTracker() != this )
    6061           0 :                 m_ctx.currentTracker().close();
    6062             : 
    6063          11 :             switch( m_runState ) {
    6064             :                 case NotStarted:
    6065             :                 case CompletedSuccessfully:
    6066             :                 case Failed:
    6067           0 :                     throw std::logic_error( "Illogical state" );
    6068             : 
    6069             :                 case NeedsAnotherRun:
    6070             :                     break;;
    6071             : 
    6072             :                 case Executing:
    6073          11 :                     m_runState = CompletedSuccessfully;
    6074          11 :                     break;
    6075             :                 case ExecutingChildren:
    6076           0 :                     if( m_children.empty() || m_children.back()->isComplete() )
    6077           0 :                         m_runState = CompletedSuccessfully;
    6078             :                     break;
    6079             : 
    6080             :                 default:
    6081           0 :                     throw std::logic_error( "Unexpected state" );
    6082             :             }
    6083          11 :             moveToParent();
    6084          11 :             m_ctx.completeCycle();
    6085          11 :         }
    6086           0 :         virtual void fail() CATCH_OVERRIDE {
    6087           0 :             m_runState = Failed;
    6088           0 :             if( m_parent )
    6089           0 :                 m_parent->markAsNeedingAnotherRun();
    6090           0 :             moveToParent();
    6091           0 :             m_ctx.completeCycle();
    6092           0 :         }
    6093           0 :         virtual void markAsNeedingAnotherRun() CATCH_OVERRIDE {
    6094           0 :             m_runState = NeedsAnotherRun;
    6095           0 :         }
    6096             :     private:
    6097             :         void moveToParent() {
    6098          11 :             assert( m_parent );
    6099          22 :             m_ctx.setCurrentTracker( m_parent );
    6100             :         }
    6101             :         void moveToThis() {
    6102          22 :             m_ctx.setCurrentTracker( this );
    6103             :         }

    6278             :     struct SignalDefs { DWORD id; const char* name; };
    6279             :     extern SignalDefs signalDefs[];
    6280             :     // There is no 1-1 mapping between signals and windows exceptions.
    6281             :     // Windows can easily distinguish between SO and SigSegV,
    6282             :     // but SigInt, SigTerm, etc are handled differently.
    6283             :     SignalDefs signalDefs[] = {
    6284             :         { EXCEPTION_ILLEGAL_INSTRUCTION,  "SIGILL - Illegal instruction signal" },
    6285             :         { EXCEPTION_STACK_OVERFLOW, "SIGSEGV - Stack overflow" },
    6286             :         { EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION, "SIGSEGV - Segmentation violation signal" },
    6287             :         { EXCEPTION_INT_DIVIDE_BY_ZERO, "Divide by zero error" },
    6288             :     };
    6289             : 
    6290             :     struct FatalConditionHandler {
    6291             : 
    6292             :         static LONG CALLBACK handleVectoredException(PEXCEPTION_POINTERS ExceptionInfo) {
    6293             :             for (int i = 0; i < sizeof(signalDefs) / sizeof(SignalDefs); ++i) {
    6294             :                 if (ExceptionInfo->ExceptionRecord->ExceptionCode == signalDefs[i].id) {
    6295             :                     reset();
    6296             :                     reportFatal(signalDefs[i].name);
    6297             :                 }
    6298             :             }
    6299             :             // If its not an exception we care about, pass it along.
    6300             :             // This stops us from eating debugger breaks etc.
    6301             :             return EXCEPTION_CONTINUE_SEARCH;
    6302             :         }
    6303             : 
    6304             :         FatalConditionHandler() {
    6305             :             isSet = true;
    6306             :             // 32k seems enough for Catch to handle stack overflow,
    6307             :             // but the value was found experimentally, so there is no strong guarantee
    6308             :             guaranteeSize = 32 * 1024;
    6309             :             exceptionHandlerHandle = CATCH_NULL;
    6310             :             // Register as first handler in current chain
    6311             :             exceptionHandlerHandle = AddVectoredExceptionHandler(1, handleVectoredException);
    6312             :             // Pass in guarantee size to be filled
    6313             :             SetThreadStackGuarantee(&guaranteeSize);
    6314             :         }
    6315             : 
    6316             :         static void reset() {
    6317             :             if (isSet) {
    6318             :                 // Unregister handler and restore the old guarantee
    6319             :                 RemoveVectoredExceptionHandler(exceptionHandlerHandle);
    6320             :                 SetThreadStackGuarantee(&guaranteeSize);
    6321             :                 exceptionHandlerHandle = CATCH_NULL;
    6322             :                 isSet = false;
    6323             :             }
    6324             :         }
    6325             : 
    6326             :         ~FatalConditionHandler() {
    6327             :             reset();
    6328             :         }

    6330             :         static bool isSet;

    7016             :     struct RandomNumberGenerator {
    7017             :         typedef std::ptrdiff_t result_type;
    7018             : 
    7019             :         result_type operator()( result_type n ) const { return std::rand() % n; }
    7020             :

    7022             :         static constexpr result_type min() { return 0; }

    7024           0 :         result_type operator()() const { return std::rand() % max(); }
    7025             : #endif
    7026             :         template<typename V>
    7027             :         static void shuffle( V& vector ) {

    7029             : #ifdef CATCH_CONFIG_CPP11_SHUFFLE
    7030           0 :             std::shuffle( vector.begin(), vector.end(), rng );
    7031             : #else
    7032             :             std::random_shuffle( vector.begin(), vector.end(), rng );
    7033             : #endif
    7034             :         }
    7035             :     };

    7037           1 :     inline std::vector<TestCase> sortTests( IConfig const& config, std::vector<TestCase> const& unsortedTestCases ) {
    7038             : 
    7039           1 :         std::vector<TestCase> sorted = unsortedTestCases;

    7043           0 :                 std::sort( sorted.begin(), sorted.end() );
    7044             :                 break;
    7045             :             case RunTests::InRandomOrder:
    7046             :                 {
    7047           0 :                     seedRng( config );
    7048             :                     RandomNumberGenerator::shuffle( sorted );
    7049             :                 }
    7050             :                 break;
    7051             :             case RunTests::InDeclarationOrder:
    7052             :                 // already in declaration order
    7053             :                 break;
    7054             :         }
    7055           1 :         return sorted;
    7056             :     }
    7057          11 :     bool matchTest( TestCase const& testCase, TestSpec const& testSpec, IConfig const& config ) {
    7058          11 :         return testSpec.matches( testCase ) && ( config.allowThrows() || !testCase.throws() );

    7061           1 :     void enforceNoDuplicateTestCases( std::vector<TestCase> const& functions ) {

    7068           0 :                 std::ostringstream ss;
    7069             : 
    7070           0 :                 ss  << Colour( Colour::Red )
    7071           0 :                     << "error: TEST_CASE( \"" << it->name << "\" ) already defined.\n"

    7074             : 
    7075           0 :                 throw std::runtime_error(ss.str());

    7077             :         }

    7115           1 :         virtual std::vector<TestCase> const& getAllTestsSorted( IConfig const& config ) const {

    7626             : 
    7627             :         virtual void use( Colour::Code _colourCode ) {
    7628             :             switch( _colourCode ) {

    7632             :                 case Colour::Green:     return setTextAttribute( FOREGROUND_GREEN );
    7633             :                 case Colour::Blue:      return setTextAttribute( FOREGROUND_BLUE );
    7634             :                 case Colour::Cyan:      return setTextAttribute( FOREGROUND_BLUE | FOREGROUND_GREEN );
    7635             :                 case Colour::Yellow:    return setTextAttribute( FOREGROUND_RED | FOREGROUND_GREEN );
    7636             :                 case Colour::Grey:      return setTextAttribute( 0 );
    7637             : 
    7638             :                 case Colour::LightGrey:     return setTextAttribute( FOREGROUND_INTENSITY );

    7640             :                 case Colour::BrightGreen:   return setTextAttribute( FOREGROUND_INTENSITY | FOREGROUND_GREEN );
    7641             :                 case Colour::BrightWhite:   return setTextAttribute( FOREGROUND_INTENSITY | FOREGROUND_GREEN | FOREGROUND_RED | FOREGROUND_BLUE );
    7642             : 
    7643             :                 case Colour::Bright: throw std::logic_error( "not a colour" );
    7644             :             }
    7645             :         }

    7936           0 :         else if( tag == "!mayfail" )

    7939             :             return TestCaseInfo::NonPortable;
    7940             :         else
    7941           0 :             return TestCaseInfo::None;

    7944           0 :         return parseSpecialTag( tag ) == TestCaseInfo::None && tag.size() > 0 && !std::isalnum( tag[0] );

    8506             : // #included from: catch_debugger.hpp
    8507             : #define TWOBLUECUBES_CATCH_DEBUGGER_HPP_INCLUDED
    8508             : 
    8509             : #ifdef CATCH_PLATFORM_MAC
    8510             : 
    8511             :     #include <assert.h>
    8512             :     #include <stdbool.h>
    8513             :     #include <sys/types.h>
    8514             :     #include <unistd.h>
    8515             :     #include <sys/sysctl.h>
    8516             : 
    8517             :     namespace Catch{
    8518             : 
    8519             :         // The following function is taken directly from the following technical note:
    8520             :         // http://developer.apple.com/library/mac/#qa/qa2004/qa1361.html
    8521             : 
    8522             :         // Returns true if the current process is being debugged (either
    8523             :         // running under the debugger or has a debugger attached post facto).
    8524             :         bool isDebuggerActive(){
    8525             : 
    8526             :             int                 mib[4];
    8527             :             struct kinfo_proc   info;
    8528             :             size_t              size;
    8529             : 
    8530             :             // Initialize the flags so that, if sysctl fails for some bizarre
    8531             :             // reason, we get a predictable result.
    8532             : 
    8533             :             info.kp_proc.p_flag = 0;
    8534             : 
    8535             :             // Initialize mib, which tells sysctl the info we want, in this case
    8536             :             // we're looking for information about a specific process ID.
    8537             : 
    8538             :             mib[0] = CTL_KERN;
    8539             :             mib[1] = KERN_PROC;
    8540             :             mib[2] = KERN_PROC_PID;
    8541             :             mib[3] = getpid();
    8542             : 
    8543             :             // Call sysctl.
    8544             : 
    8545             :             size = sizeof(info);
    8546             :             if( sysctl(mib, sizeof(mib) / sizeof(*mib), &info, &size, CATCH_NULL, 0) != 0 ) {
    8547             :                 Catch::cerr() << "\n** Call to sysctl failed - unable to determine if debugger is active **\n" << std::endl;
    8548             :                 return false;
    8549             :             }
    8550             : 
    8551             :             // We're being debugged if the P_TRACED flag is set.
    8552             : 
    8553             :             return ( (info.kp_proc.p_flag & P_TRACED) != 0 );
    8554             :         }
    8555             :     } // namespace Catch
    8556             : 
    8557             : #elif defined(CATCH_PLATFORM_LINUX)
    8558             :     #include <fstream>
    8559             :     #include <string>
    8560             : 
    8561             :     namespace Catch{
    8562             :         // The standard POSIX way of detecting a debugger is to attempt to
    8563             :         // ptrace() the process, but this needs to be done from a child and not
    8564             :         // this process itself to still allow attaching to this process later
    8565             :         // if wanted, so is rather heavy. Under Linux we have the PID of the
    8566             :         // "debugger" (which doesn't need to be gdb, of course, it could also
    8567             :         // be strace, for example) in /proc/$PID/status, so just get it from
    8568             :         // there instead.
    8569           1 :         bool isDebuggerActive(){
    8570           2 :             std::ifstream in("/proc/self/status");
    8571          14 :             for( std::string line; std::getline(in, line); ) {
    8572             :                 static const int PREFIX_LEN = 11;
    8573           7 :                 if( line.compare(0, PREFIX_LEN, "TracerPid:\t") == 0 ) {
    8574             :                     // We're traced if the PID is not 0 and no other PID starts
    8575             :                     // with 0 digit, so it's enough to check for just a single
    8576             :                     // character.
    8577           3 :                     return line.length() > PREFIX_LEN && line[PREFIX_LEN] != '0';
    8578             :                 }
    8579             :             }
    8580             : 
    8581           0 :             return false;
    8582             :         }
    8583             :     } // namespace Catch
    8584             : #elif defined(_MSC_VER)
    8585             :     extern "C" __declspec(dllimport) int __stdcall IsDebuggerPresent();
    8586             :     namespace Catch {
    8587             :         bool isDebuggerActive() {
    8588             :             return IsDebuggerPresent() != 0;
    8589             :         }
    8590             :     }
    8591             : #elif defined(__MINGW32__)
    8592             :     extern "C" __declspec(dllimport) int __stdcall IsDebuggerPresent();
    8593             :     namespace Catch {
    8594             :         bool isDebuggerActive() {
    8595             :             return IsDebuggerPresent() != 0;
    8596             :         }
    8597             :     }
    8598             : #else
    8599             :     namespace Catch {
    8600             :        inline bool isDebuggerActive() { return false; }
    8601             :     }
    8602             : #endif // Platform
    8603             : 
    8604             : #ifdef CATCH_PLATFORM_WINDOWS
    8605             : 
    8606             :     namespace Catch {
    8607             :         void writeToDebugConsole( std::string const& text ) {
    8608             :             ::OutputDebugStringA( text.c_str() );
    8609             :         }
    8610             :     }
    8611             : #else
    8612             :     namespace Catch {
    8613           0 :         void writeToDebugConsole( std::string const& text ) {

    8619             : 
    8620             : // #included from: catch_tostring.hpp
    8621             : #define TWOBLUECUBES_CATCH_TOSTRING_HPP_INCLUDED
    8622             : 
    8623             : namespace Catch {
    8624             : 
    8625             : namespace Detail {
    8626             : 
    8627           3 :     const std::string unprintableString = "{?}";
    8628             : 
    8629             :     namespace {
    8630             :         const int hexThreshold = 255;
    8631             : 
    8632             :         struct Endianness {
    8633             :             enum Arch { Big, Little };
    8634             : 
    8635             :             static Arch which() {
    8636             :                 union _{
    8637             :                     int asInt;
    8638             :                     char asChar[sizeof (int)];
    8639             :                 } u;
    8640             : 
    8641             :                 u.asInt = 1;
    8642             :                 return ( u.asChar[sizeof(int)-1] == 1 ) ? Big : Little;
    8643             :             }
    8644             :         };
    8645             :     }
    8646             : 
    8647           0 :     std::string rawMemoryToString( const void *object, std::size_t size )
    8648             :     {
    8649             :         // Reverse order for little endian architectures
    8650           0 :         int i = 0, end = static_cast<int>( size ), inc = 1;
    8651             :         if( Endianness::which() == Endianness::Little ) {
    8652           0 :             i = end-1;
    8653           0 :             end = inc = -1;
    8654             :         }
    8655             : 
    8656           0 :         unsigned char const *bytes = static_cast<unsigned char const *>(object);
    8657           0 :         std::ostringstream os;
    8658           0 :         os << "0x" << std::setfill('0') << std::hex;
    8659           0 :         for( ; i != end; i += inc )
    8660           0 :              os << std::setw(2) << static_cast<unsigned>(bytes[i]);
    8661           0 :        return os.str();
    8662             :     }
    8663             : }
    8664             : 
    8665           0 : std::string toString( std::string const& value ) {
    8666           0 :     std::string s = value;
    8667           0 :     if( getCurrentContext().getConfig()->showInvisibles() ) {
    8668           0 :         for(size_t i = 0; i < s.size(); ++i ) {
    8669           0 :             std::string subs;
    8670           0 :             switch( s[i] ) {
    8671             :             case '\n': subs = "\\n"; break;
    8672             :             case '\t': subs = "\\t"; break;
    8673             :             default: break;
    8674             :             }
    8675           0 :             if( !subs.empty() ) {

    8910             :             ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
    8911             :             // To inspect the state during test, you need to go one level up the callstack
    8912             :             // To go back to the test and change execution, jump over the throw statement
    8913             :             ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
    8914             :             CATCH_BREAK_INTO_DEBUGGER();
    8915             :         }

    8924           0 :     AssertionResult ResultBuilder::build() const

    8926           0 :         return build( *this );

    8928             : 
    8929             :     // CAVEAT: The returned AssertionResult stores a pointer to the argument expr,
    8930             :     //         a temporary DecomposedExpression, which in turn holds references to
    8931             :     //         operands, possibly temporary as well.
    8932             :     //         It should immediately be passed to handleResult; if the expression
    8933             :     //         needs to be reported, its string expansion must be composed before
    8934             :     //         the temporaries are destroyed.

    9421           0 :         virtual void assertionStarting( AssertionInfo const& ) CATCH_OVERRIDE {}

    9423           0 :         virtual bool assertionEnded( AssertionStats const& assertionStats ) CATCH_OVERRIDE {
    9424           0 :             assert( !m_sectionStack.empty() );
    9425           0 :             SectionNode& sectionNode = *m_sectionStack.back();
    9426           0 :             sectionNode.assertions.push_back( assertionStats );
    9427             :             // AssertionResult holds a pointer to a temporary DecomposedExpression,
    9428             :             // which getExpandedExpression() calls to build the expression string.
    9429             :             // Our section stack copy of the assertionResult will likely outlive the
    9430             :             // temporary, so it must be expanded or discarded now to avoid calling
    9431             :             // a destroyed object later.
    9432           0 :             prepareExpandedExpression( sectionNode.assertions.back().assertionResult );
    9433           0 :             return true;
    9434             :         }

    9518             :     template<typename T>
    9519             :     class LegacyReporterRegistrar {
    9520             : 
    9521             :         class ReporterFactory : public IReporterFactory {
    9522             :             virtual IStreamingReporter* create( ReporterConfig const& config ) const {
    9523             :                 return new LegacyReporterAdapter( new T( config ) );
    9524             :             }
    9525             : 
    9526             :             virtual std::string getDescription() const {
    9527             :                 return T::getDescription();
    9528             :             }
    9529             :         };
    9530             : 
    9531             :     public:
    9532             : 
    9533             :         LegacyReporterRegistrar( std::string const& name ) {
    9534             :             getMutableRegistryHub().registerReporter( name, new ReporterFactory() );
    9535             :         }
    9536             :     };
    9537             : 
    9538             :     template<typename T>
    9539             :     class ReporterRegistrar {
    9540             : 
    9541          16 :         class ReporterFactory : public SharedImpl<IReporterFactory> {
    9542             : 
    9543             :             // *** Please Note ***:
    9544             :             // - If you end up here looking at a compiler error because it's trying to register
    9545             :             // your custom reporter class be aware that the native reporter interface has changed
    9546             :             // to IStreamingReporter. The "legacy" interface, IReporter, is still supported via
    9547             :             // an adapter. Just use REGISTER_LEGACY_REPORTER to take advantage of the adapter.
    9548             :             // However please consider updating to the new interface as the old one is now
    9549             :             // deprecated and will probably be removed quite soon!
    9550             :             // Please contact me via github if you have any questions at all about this.
    9551             :             // In fact, ideally, please contact me anyway to let me know you've hit this - as I have
    9552             :             // no idea who is actually using custom reporters at all (possibly no-one!).
    9553             :             // The new interface is designed to minimise exposure to interface changes in the future.
    9554           1 :             virtual IStreamingReporter* create( ReporterConfig const& config ) const {
    9555           2 :                 return new T( config );
    9556             :             }
    9557             : 
    9558           0 :             virtual std::string getDescription() const {
    9559           0 :                 return T::getDescription();
    9560             :             }
    9561             :         };
    9562             : 
    9563             :     public:
    9564             : 
    9565           4 :         ReporterRegistrar( std::string const& name ) {
    9566          12 :             getMutableRegistryHub().registerReporter( name, new ReporterFactory() );
    9567           4 :         }
    9568             :     };
    9569             : 
    9570             :     template<typename T>
    9571             :     class ListenerRegistrar {
    9572             : 
    9573             :         class ListenerFactory : public SharedImpl<IReporterFactory> {
    9574             : 
    9575             :             virtual IStreamingReporter* create( ReporterConfig const& config ) const {
    9576             :                 return new T( config );
    9577             :             }
    9578             :             virtual std::string getDescription() const {
    9579             :                 return std::string();
    9580             :             }
    9581             :         };
    9582             : 
    9583             :     public:
    9584             : 
    9585             :         ListenerRegistrar() {
    9586             :             getMutableRegistryHub().registerListener( new ListenerFactory() );
    9587             :         }
    9588             :     };
    9589             : }
    9590             :

    9600             : // #included from: ../internal/catch_xmlwriter.hpp
    9601             : #define TWOBLUECUBES_CATCH_XMLWRITER_HPP_INCLUDED
    9602             : 
    9603             : #include <sstream>

    9607             : 
    9608             : namespace Catch {
    9609             : 
    9610           0 :     class XmlEncode {
    9611             :     public:
    9612             :         enum ForWhat { ForTextNodes, ForAttributes };
    9613             : 
    9614             :         XmlEncode( std::string const& str, ForWhat forWhat = ForTextNodes )
    9615             :         :   m_str( str ),
    9616           0 :             m_forWhat( forWhat )
    9617             :         {}
    9618             : 
    9619           0 :         void encodeTo( std::ostream& os ) const {
    9620             : 
    9621             :             // Apostrophe escaping not necessary if we always use " to write attributes
    9622             :             // (see: http://www.w3.org/TR/xml/#syntax)
    9623             : 
    9624           0 :             for( std::size_t i = 0; i < m_str.size(); ++ i ) {
    9625           0 :                 char c = m_str[i];
    9626           0 :                 switch( c ) {
    9627           0 :                     case '<':   os << "&lt;"; break;
    9628           0 :                     case '&':   os << "&amp;"; break;
    9629             : 
    9630             :                     case '>':
    9631             :                         // See: http://www.w3.org/TR/xml/#syntax
    9632           0 :                         if( i > 2 && m_str[i-1] == ']' && m_str[i-2] == ']' )
    9633           0 :                             os << "&gt;";
    9634             :                         else
    9635           0 :                             os << c;
    9636             :                         break;
    9637             : 
    9638             :                     case '\"':
    9639           0 :                         if( m_forWhat == ForAttributes )
    9640           0 :                             os << "&quot;";
    9641             :                         else
    9642           0 :                             os << c;
    9643             :                         break;
    9644             : 
    9645             :                     default:
    9646             :                         // Escape control chars - based on contribution by @espenalb in PR #465 and
    9647             :                         // by @mrpi PR #588
    9648           0 :                         if ( ( c >= 0 && c < '\x09' ) || ( c > '\x0D' && c < '\x20') || c=='\x7F' ) {
    9649             :                             // see http://stackoverflow.com/questions/404107/why-are-control-characters-illegal-in-xml-1-0
    9650           0 :                             os << "\\x" << std::uppercase << std::hex << std::setfill('0') << std::setw(2)
    9651           0 :                                << static_cast<int>( c );
    9652             :                         }
    9653             :                         else
    9654           0 :                             os << c;
    9655             :                 }
    9656             :             }
    9657           0 :         }
    9658             :

   10303             :         // Because formatting using c++ streams is stateful, drop down to C is required
   10304             :         // Alternatively we could use stringstream, but its performance is... not good.
   10305             :         std::string getFormattedDuration( double duration ) {
   10306             :             // Max exponent + 1 is required to represent the whole part
   10307             :             // + 1 for decimal point
   10308             :             // + 3 for the 3 decimal places
   10309             :             // + 1 for null terminator
   10310           0 :             const size_t maxDoubleSize = DBL_MAX_10_EXP + 1 + 1 + 3 + 1;
   10311             :             char buffer[maxDoubleSize];
   10312             : #ifdef _MSC_VER
   10313             :             sprintf_s(buffer, "%.3f", duration);
   10314             : #else
   10315           0 :             sprintf(buffer, "%.3f", duration);
   10316             : #endif
   10317           0 :             return std::string(buffer);
   10318             :         }
   10319             :     }

   10609             :         // if string has a : in first line will set indent to follow it on
   10610             :         // subsequent lines

   10622           0 :         struct SummaryColumn {
   10623             : 
   10624             :             SummaryColumn( std::string const& _label, Colour::Code _colour )
   10625             :             :   label( _label ),
   10626           0 :                 colour( _colour )
   10627             :             {}
   10628           0 :             SummaryColumn addRow( std::size_t count ) {
   10629           0 :                 std::ostringstream oss;
   10630           0 :                 oss << count;
   10631           0 :                 std::string row = oss.str();
   10632           0 :                 for( std::vector<std::string>::iterator it = rows.begin(); it != rows.end(); ++it ) {
   10633           0 :                     while( it->size() < row.size() )
   10634           0 :                         *it = ' ' + *it;
   10635           0 :                     while( it->size() > row.size() )
   10636           0 :                         row = ' ' + row;
   10637             :                 }
   10638           0 :                 rows.push_back( row );
   10639           0 :                 return *this;
   10640             :             }
   10641             :

   10648           1 :         void printTotals( Totals const& totals ) {
   10649           2 :             if( totals.testCases.total() == 0 ) {
   10650           0 :                 stream << Colour( Colour::Warning ) << "No tests ran\n";
   10651             :             }
   10652           3 :             else if( totals.assertions.total() > 0 && totals.testCases.allPassed() ) {
   10653           2 :                 stream << Colour( Colour::ResultSuccess ) << "All tests passed";
   10654           2 :                 stream << " ("
   10655           8 :                         << pluralise( totals.assertions.passed, "assertion" ) << " in "
   10656           8 :                         << pluralise( totals.testCases.passed, "test case" ) << ')'
   10657           1 :                         << '\n';
   10658             :             }
   10659             :             else {
   10660             : 
   10661           0 :                 std::vector<SummaryColumn> columns;
   10662             :                 columns.push_back( SummaryColumn( "", Colour::None )
   10663           0 :                                         .addRow( totals.testCases.total() )
   10664           0 :                                         .addRow( totals.assertions.total() ) );

   10666           0 :                                         .addRow( totals.testCases.passed )
   10667           0 :                                         .addRow( totals.assertions.passed ) );
   10668             :                 columns.push_back( SummaryColumn( "failed", Colour::ResultError )
   10669           0 :                                         .addRow( totals.testCases.failed )
   10670           0 :                                         .addRow( totals.assertions.failed ) );
   10671             :                 columns.push_back( SummaryColumn( "failed as expected", Colour::ResultExpectedFailure )
   10672           0 :                                         .addRow( totals.testCases.failedButOk )
   10673           0 :                                         .addRow( totals.assertions.failedButOk ) );
   10674             : 
   10675           0 :                 printSummaryRow( "test cases", columns, 0 );
   10676           0 :                 printSummaryRow( "assertions", columns, 1 );
   10677             :             }
   10678           1 :         }
   10679           0 :         void printSummaryRow( std::string const& label, std::vector<SummaryColumn> const& cols, std::size_t row ) {
   10680           0 :             for( std::vector<SummaryColumn>::const_iterator it = cols.begin(); it != cols.end(); ++it ) {
   10681           0 :                 std::string value = it->rows[row];
   10682           0 :                 if( it->label.empty() ) {
   10683           0 :                     stream << label << ": ";
   10684           0 :                     if( value != "0" )
   10685           0 :                         stream << value;
   10686             :                     else
   10687           0 :                         stream << Colour( Colour::Warning ) << "- none -";
   10688             :                 }
   10689           0 :                 else if( value != "0" ) {
   10690           0 :                     stream  << Colour( Colour::LightGrey ) << " | ";
   10691           0 :                     stream  << Colour( it->colour )
   10692           0 :                             << value << ' ' << it->label;
   10693             :                 }
   10694             :             }
   10695           0 :             stream << '\n';
   10696           0 :         }
   10697             : 
   10698             :         static std::size_t makeRatio( std::size_t number, std::size_t total ) {
   10699           3 :             std::size_t ratio = total > 0 ? CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH * number/ total : 0;
   10700           3 :             return ( ratio == 0 && number > 0 ) ? 1 : ratio;
   10701             :         }
   10702             :         static std::size_t& findMax( std::size_t& i, std::size_t& j, std::size_t& k ) {
   10703           1 :             if( i > j && i > k )
   10704             :                 return i;
   10705           1 :             else if( j > k )
   10706             :                 return j;
   10707             :             else
   10708             :                 return k;
   10709             :         }
   10710             : 
   10711           1 :         void printTotalsDivider( Totals const& totals ) {
   10712           2 :             if( totals.testCases.total() > 0 ) {
   10713           2 :                 std::size_t failedRatio = makeRatio( totals.testCases.failed, totals.testCases.total() );
   10714           2 :                 std::size_t failedButOkRatio = makeRatio( totals.testCases.failedButOk, totals.testCases.total() );
   10715           2 :                 std::size_t passedRatio = makeRatio( totals.testCases.passed, totals.testCases.total() );
   10716           1 :                 while( failedRatio + failedButOkRatio + passedRatio < CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH-1 )
   10717           0 :                     findMax( failedRatio, failedButOkRatio, passedRatio )++;
   10718           3 :                 while( failedRatio + failedButOkRatio + passedRatio > CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH-1 )
   10719           1 :                     findMax( failedRatio, failedButOkRatio, passedRatio )--;
   10720             : 
   10721           8 :                 stream << Colour( Colour::Error ) << std::string( failedRatio, '=' );
   10722           8 :                 stream << Colour( Colour::ResultExpectedFailure ) << std::string( failedButOkRatio, '=' );
   10723           2 :                 if( totals.testCases.allPassed() )
   10724           8 :                     stream << Colour( Colour::ResultSuccess ) << std::string( passedRatio, '=' );
   10725             :                 else
   10726           0 :                     stream << Colour( Colour::Success ) << std::string( passedRatio, '=' );
   10727             :             }
   10728             :             else {
   10729           0 :                 stream << Colour( Colour::Warning ) << std::string( CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH-1, '=' );
   10730             :             }
   10731           2 :             stream << '\n';
   10732           1 :         }
   10733           0 :         void printSummaryDivider() {
   10734           0 :             stream << getLineOfChars<'-'>() << '\n';
   10735           0 :         }

   10980             : 
   10981             :         // Colour, message variants:
   10982             :         // - white: No tests ran.
   10983             :         // -   red: Failed [both/all] N test cases, failed [both/all] M assertions.
   10984             :         // - white: Passed [both/all] N test cases (no assertions).
   10985             :         // -   red: Failed N tests cases, failed M assertions.
   10986             :         // - green: Passed [both/all] N tests cases with M assertions.
   10987             : 
   10988             :         std::string bothOrAll( std::size_t count ) const {
   10989           0 :             return count == 1 ? std::string() : count == 2 ? "both " : "all " ;
   10990             :         }
   10991             : 
   10992           0 :         void printTotals( const Totals& totals ) const {
   10993           0 :             if( totals.testCases.total() == 0 ) {
   10994           0 :                 stream << "No tests ran.";
   10995             :             }
   10996           0 :             else if( totals.testCases.failed == totals.testCases.total() ) {
   10997           0 :                 Colour colour( Colour::ResultError );
   10998             :                 const std::string qualify_assertions_failed =
   10999           0 :                     totals.assertions.failed == totals.assertions.total() ?
   11000           0 :                         bothOrAll( totals.assertions.failed ) : std::string();
   11001           0 :                 stream <<
   11002           0 :                     "Failed " << bothOrAll( totals.testCases.failed )
   11003           0 :                               << pluralise( totals.testCases.failed, "test case"  ) << ", "
   11004           0 :                     "failed " << qualify_assertions_failed <<
   11005           0 :                                  pluralise( totals.assertions.failed, "assertion" ) << '.';
   11006             :             }
   11007           0 :             else if( totals.assertions.total() == 0 ) {
   11008           0 :                 stream <<
   11009           0 :                     "Passed " << bothOrAll( totals.testCases.total() )
   11010           0 :                               << pluralise( totals.testCases.total(), "test case" )
   11011           0 :                               << " (no assertions).";
   11012             :             }
   11013           0 :             else if( totals.assertions.failed ) {
   11014           0 :                 Colour colour( Colour::ResultError );
   11015           0 :                 stream <<
   11016           0 :                     "Failed " << pluralise( totals.testCases.failed, "test case"  ) << ", "
   11017           0 :                     "failed " << pluralise( totals.assertions.failed, "assertion" ) << '.';
   11018             :             }
   11019             :             else {
   11020           0 :                 Colour colour( Colour::ResultSuccess );
   11021           0 :                 stream <<
   11022           0 :                     "Passed " << bothOrAll( totals.testCases.passed )
   11023           0 :                               << pluralise( totals.testCases.passed, "test case"  ) <<
   11024           0 :                     " with "  << pluralise( totals.assertions.passed, "assertion" ) << '.';
   11025             :             }
   11026           0 :         }
   11027             :     };

   11103             : // Standard C/C++ main entry point
   11104             : int main (int argc, char * argv[]) {
   11105             :         int result = Catch::Session().run( argc, argv );
   11106             :     return ( result < 0xff ? result : 0xff );

   11110             : 
   11111             : // Objective-C entry point
   11112             : int main (int argc, char * const argv[]) {
   11113             : #if !CATCH_ARC_ENABLED
   11114             :     NSAutoreleasePool * pool = [[NSAutoreleasePool alloc] init];
   11115             : #endif
   11116             :

   11119             : 
   11120             : #if !CATCH_ARC_ENABLED
   11121             :     [pool drain];
   11122             : #endif

   11124             :     return ( result < 0xff ? result : 0xff );

   11135             : //////
   11136             : 
   11137             : // If this config identifier is defined then all CATCH macros are prefixed with CATCH_
   11138             : #ifdef CATCH_CONFIG_PREFIX_ALL
   11139             : 
   11140             : #define CATCH_REQUIRE( expr ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TEST( expr, Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal, "CATCH_REQUIRE" )
   11141             : #define CATCH_REQUIRE_FALSE( expr ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TEST( expr, Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal | Catch::ResultDisposition::FalseTest, "CATCH_REQUIRE_FALSE" )
   11142             : 
   11143             : #define CATCH_REQUIRE_THROWS( expr ) INTERNAL_CATCH_THROWS( expr, Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal, "", "CATCH_REQUIRE_THROWS" )
   11144             : #define CATCH_REQUIRE_THROWS_AS( expr, exceptionType ) INTERNAL_CATCH_THROWS_AS( expr, exceptionType, Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal, "CATCH_REQUIRE_THROWS_AS" )
